title: What’s in the Trump Policy Bill?
summary: We take a closer look at some less discussed provisions.

title: The Republicans in Congress Who Are Opting to Self-Deport From Washington
summary: Feeling out of step with President Trump’s G.O.P., Senator Thom Tillis and Representative Don Bacon are deciding to retire.

title: Elon Musk Promises a New Political Party if Republicans Pass Trump’s Policy Bill
summary: The billionaire and former Trump adviser suggested that if the domestic policy bill passed, he would swiftly form a new “America Party” and back primary challenges to Republicans.

title: ‘Horror Show’ at Detention Facility, and the Dollar’s Big Drop
summary: Plus, three new teams for the WNBA.

title: California Rolls Back Its Landmark Environmental Law
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and state lawmakers scaled back a law that was vilified for its role in California’s housing shortage and homelessness crisis.

title: Under a Drone-Swarmed Sky: Surviving in Eastern Ukraine
summary: Towns and troops long accustomed to merciless bombardment are adjusting to an even denser pattern of attacks.

title: Bryan Kohberger, Suspect in Idaho Student Murders, Accepts Plea Deal
summary: Bryan Kohberger, a former criminology student, is charged in the stabbing deaths of four University of Idaho students. Prosecutors said they had reached a plea agreement that avoids the death penalty.

title: Restaurant Review: Acamaya in New Orleans
summary: In her first review as our new critic, Tejal Rao visits Acamaya, where the chef Ana Castro is writing the latest chapter in the city’s rich culinary story.

title: The Dollar Has Its Worst Start to a Year Since 1973
summary: It has continued to slide even as President Trump has backed down from his tariff threats and the U.S. stock market has recovered from its losses.

title: As Debt Piles Up, Countries See Fiscal Relief as Political Leverage
summary: With developing nations crushed by unaffordable borrowing and Washington on the sidelines, some leaders are brokering debt forgiveness deals.

title: Appeals Court Weighs Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act for Deportations
summary: The case is likely to be the first to reach the Supreme Court on the substantive issue of the president’s invocation of a rarely used wartime law.

title: Bush, Obama and Bono Commend USAID Staff Members on Their Last Day
summary: Two ex-presidents and a rock star thanked the outgoing workers of a doomed agency.

title: Steve Bannon’s Battle for the Soul of MAGA
summary: The former White House chief strategist speaks about the threats he sees to the political movement that formed around Donald J. Trump.

title: NYC Panel Approves Rent Increases, a Key Issue for Mamdani and Adams
summary: Mayor Eric Adams, who appointed the Rent Guidelines Board, has attacked Zohran Mamdani’s pledge to freeze the rent if he becomes mayor.

title: What to Know About Ranked-Choice Results in the N.Y.C. Mayor’s Race
summary: Since no candidate received 50 percent of the vote on Primary Day, the Board of Elections proceeded to ranked-choice tabulations, which will be released on Tuesday.

title: New Yorkers May Vote on Curbing Council’s Power to Block New Housing
summary: The City Council can block the development of new housing. A panel created by Mayor Eric Adams wants to let voters weigh in on reducing the Council’s power.

title: How the Hottest Place in India Survives
summary: It’s 40 degrees Celsius (104 Fahrenheit), and it’s only 10 a.m. Welcome to Sri Ganganagar.

title: Dangerous Heat Grips Much of Europe, With More to Come
summary: A punishing heat wave broke records in southern Europe and hasn’t peaked yet in some places, prompting warnings to residents, employers and tourists to alter their habits.

title: With Tillis Out, North Carolina’s Senate Race Will Draw Parties’ Firepower
summary: A popular former Democratic governor, Roy Cooper, is expected to announce a bid this summer. The Republicans are banking on an endorsement by President Trump to clear their field.

title: Colin Allred Will Run Again for Senate in Texas
summary: After losing to Ted Cruz last year, Mr. Allred is planning his second statewide run and looking for a stronger political climate for Democrats.

title: The Most Stylish People of 2025, So Far
summary: Some wore vestments, others scrubs. Some were on courts, others in court. All have shaped the look of the year.

title: Wimbledon 2025: How the World’s Oldest Tennis Tournament is Coping with the Heat Wave
summary: With 6,700 refillable water bottles, “shade mapping” and ice packs, the world’s oldest championship tennis tournament is taking Britain’s heat wave seriously.

title: My First America
summary: When I was a teenager, a mostly forgotten series of novels taught me U.S. history. How would they read to me now?

title: Trump May Get His ‘Big Beautiful Bill,’ but the G.O.P. Will Pay a Price
summary: And so will many voters.

title: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra Suspended Amid Cambodia Dispute
summary: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is accused of ethical lapses in a conversation with the Cambodian leader Hun Sen and has faced calls to resign.

title: BP, Once a Hunter in the Oil Industry, Is Now Prey. What Went Wrong?
summary: The energy giant has been weakened by years of mishaps and poor decisions, leading to rumors of a takeover that may not subside.

title: At 91, an Idiosyncratic Judge Prepares for His Latest Big Case
summary: Judge Frederic Block will oversee the prosecution of Rafael Caro Quintero, a Mexican drug lord, which could end in the death penalty. In the meantime, there’s stand-up comedy to keep him busy.

title: Cloudflare Introduces Blocking of A.I. Scrapers By Default
summary: The tech company’s customers can automatically block A.I. companies from exploiting their websites, it said, as it moves to protect original content online.
